title: Vaskiy
author: Vaskiy
content: Amidst the heavy taxation on cryptocurrency, the acceptance of cryptocurrencies have been increasing all around. A fine example for the same is the acceptance of cryptocurrencies by this street chai (tea) Shop accepting cryptocurrency. This is located in Bangalore which is one among the IT City of India. Hope this creates awareness and increase of usage among Indians.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Question I guess, if people would be still willing to transact using crypto, especially at this point wherein the market is still down. What's likely to happen is that users, especially investors, won't prefer using theur assets to buy things. But the idea or thought is there -- adaptation. Given how unstable the situation is, I think it will be still a long run before fiat and crypto coexist on a daily basis. It is just amazing how crypto related ideas are being raised for awareness to those who are not knowledgeable into it yet.

comments.author: aquafinewater
comments.body: Yea no dout in this now many countries accepted cryptocurrency payment due to this I,m sure. Crypto has a bright future and in coming future cryptocurrency using as a local currency in all over the world

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: At least those vendors on the street can have that kind of technology. I don't think the people here in my country would easily accept Bitcoin because they wouldn't understand what to do with it and probably reject its innovation and how it could help them in the long run. They would prefer the fiat way where paper money is king and probably not digital.Nevertheless, I hope it will increase adoption in other countries, and everyone will follow suit. I do hope that happens.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Not accepted everywhereNot legal everywhereBut it can not stop cryptocurrency to be accepted more and become legal in more locations in futureThis is a process that takes a long time to finish but we will have it and cryptocurrency will not leave anywhere. Along its adoption and increasing acceptance, there will be come and go projects. It is same as businesses, companies are created and die. Some will succeed and will stay for long.

comments.body: Quote from: Vaskiy on August 25, 2022, 02:26:03 PMAmidst the heavy taxation on cryptocurrency, the acceptance of cryptocurrencies have been increasing all around. A fine example for the same is the acceptance of cryptocurrencies by this street chai (tea) Shop accepting cryptocurrency. This is located in Bangalore which is one among the IT City of India. Hope this creates awareness and increase of usage among Indians.I have no problem getting taxed because we are obliged in doing so as income earners to help with the economy. Crypto taxes aren't yet being structured in the Philippines despite it's generally considered to be taxable under realized income (crypto to fiat conversion). I would likely choose to pay taxes than getting banned in the country as regulation is definitely needed to increase more adoption.Same here in the Philippines where the acceptance has been increasing and it'll never stop. Recently, Binance will be partnering with Philippine universities to introduce Bitcoin and crypto related courses in the curriculum.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: There's many countries still ban Bitcoin, how it's possible for other crypto to get accepted? of course they need to wait until Bitcoin fully accepted in the whole countries in this world first.AFAIK India is banning Bitcoin isn't? or they implemented insane fees for around 40% if I'm not wrong. I don't think it's a good moment to accept crypto payment when the fees is really higher and not fully legal. Because it would harm his reputation and broke the law.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Its simple to say that the taxation is too much, but, ideas differs, imagine the kiosk owner to be a cryptocurrency trader. It doesn't stop him from trading while doing a real life business. For instance, I open a shop in my street or somewhere, I'll definitely accept bitcoin because its useful to my side business, trading cryptocurrency, many traders are going into real life businesses and it'll help disseminate  the use of bitcoin. In the world of economy today, a little business added to your online business can make a huge difference to your earnings, and when that happens you are likely to accept bitcoin. In a nutshell, I think those who accept bitcoin know what to do with bitcoin regardless of the volatility.

In a nutshell, I think those who accept bitcoin know what to do with bitcoin regardless of the volatility.This looks good if your country does not prohibit accepting Bitcoin payments, that is, making financial transactions. What if you are breaking the law? What will be the punishment in this case? I say this because in my country it takes a very long time to decide the laws on the adoption or prohibition of cryptocurrencies. The government moves from plus to minus and vice versa. And as long as bitcoin is an unregulated coin, we will have to wait a very long time for things like accepting payment or buying with bitcoin.

comments.author: qwertyup23
comments.body: As far as I know, one of the local exchanges in India has closed down due to implementing stringent regulations and guidelines by their government? Not sure on how it proceeded but the fact that there are people accepting cryptocurrencies as payment to their services/products gives hope for its wide-scale implementation in the future.To be honest, there are other forum members who posted several threads introducing and implementing the payment of cryptocurrencies in their respective businesses. The more people post about it, the more businesses would accept cryptocurrency as a mode of alternative payment.

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: That guy must be very enthusiastic about crypto currencies. His doing all he could with his small roadside business. I love his inspiration and could not thank him more to show such bravery of putting that tag openly. Yup, Bangalore is metropolitan and highest IT people live there and definitely the chai or tea is favourite drink in the region. Many people are going to notice that tag, they gonna approach him, ask him about it and get involved with it. I am pretty sure he will make it into local news paper real soon. Hope he gets his goals achieved to collect as much bitcoins as he could and wait for it to boom. The taxes would be nothing in the later part anyways.

comments.author: ChiBitCTy
comments.body: This is a good thing but also potentially could have a negative recourse based off of governments and their allowance of bitcoin.  We know that there are a decent amount of countries who've banned bitcoin, and unfortunately I could see this number rising if countries believe it's effecting their own currencies bottom line.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: No doubts about it that cryptocurrency is certainly the future of money and the earlier that people start to understand this the better for the early birds. Fed chairman Jerome Powell made it clear in one of his interview during the Corona virus outbreak 2019-2020 "stated that they're not going back to the same economy, we're recovering but we're moving into an economy that is more leverage to technology which is "Blockchain"(Bitcoin and CBDC's).And too coupled with the fact that the fourth industrial revolution is starting to be rolling out at same time,Therefore Bitcoin and cryptocurrency transactions is gonna be everywhere in the future, To an extent where robbots are gonna pay each other with cryptos in future and it's just a matter of time.

comments.body: Is the area a tourist? Because the value in US dollars is rarely put in the popular markets, which is shown in the background of the image.The price of coffee is less than a dollar so it would be great if there was a lightning network payment option but it is good to see more daily use rather than speculating in these currencies.If you use social media, this person will get more visitors.
